filteredArticles.headline: New Wharton initiative will introduce students to the world of artificial intelligence
filteredArticles.abstract: The program aims to inspire teaching and research in the field of AI and will be led by professor Kartik Hosanagar.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

filteredArticles.headline: Africana Studies and English prof. Herman Beavers appointed Civic House faculty director
filteredArticles.abstract: Beavers will succeed Walter H. Annenberg Professor of History Walter Licht, who served as the Civic House faculty director since 2002, and the founder of its Civic Scholars program.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

History prof. Walter Licht will step down as Civic House faculty director in June

Vice Provost for University Life will leave position for new student engagement role

dominantMedia.title: Herman Beavers.JPG
dominantMedia.content: As the new faculty director of Civic House and the Civic Scholars program, Beavers seeks to create mutually beneficial, non-exploitative relationships with the West Philadelphia community.

filteredArticles.headline: Wharton coronavirus course taken by over 2,400 people deemed a success by students, faculty
filteredArticles.abstract: Guest lecturers included Penn President Amy Gutmann, National Bureau of Economic Research Fellow Kent Smetters, and Wharton Dean Geoffrey Garrett, among others.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Gutmann criticizes U.S. for ‘striking lack’ of global leadership during coronavirus course

Wharton introduces six-week online course on coronavirus and global crisis management

dominantMedia.title: Wharton Coronavirus Class Mauro Guillen Geoffrey Garrett Final.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Professor Mauro Guillén spoke with guest lecturer and Wharton Dean Geoffrey Garrett on April 29, the final session of the course.

filteredArticles.headline: Here’s how Philadelphia-area colleges are planning for the fall semester
filteredArticles.abstract: Institutions in the Philadelphia region are considering many variations of college life, including full in-person instruction, hybrid in-person and virtual instruction, and a fully virtual semester.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Penn outlines four possible scenarios for fall 2020, will finalize plan by end of June

Here’s how the Ivy League is planning for the fall semester

dominantMedia.title: Penn Campus Fall.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Penn is currently considering four scenarios for the fall semester.

filteredArticles.headline: Penn adds 300 seats to summer courses to compensate for 70% increase in enrollment
filteredArticles.abstract: Each undergraduate school will likely continue to add more courses, seats, and sections for Summer Session II as students continue to demonstrate interest to their academic advisors.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

filteredArticles.headline: Nursing students worry missed clinical hours, online replacements leave them underprepared
filteredArticles.abstract: Although Nursing students were initially told they could continue their clinical rotations, the School of Nursing announced on March 13 that Penn Medicine and its affiliates placed an indefinite hold on clinical placements at their facilities.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED: 

Canceled Nursing clinicals throw graduation and future course planning into disarray

UA fills vacant Nursing seat with special election – but only 17 people voted

Penn Nursing receives most NIH funding for third consecutive year

dominantMedia.title: Penn Medicine Tents Spring 2020 Coronavirus.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Penn Medicine facilities, one option for Nursing students to fulfill their rotations at, have put clinical placements on hold indefinitely.

filteredArticles.headline: Engineering students find online classes less engaging, worry about a remote fall semester
filteredArticles.abstract: Penn's School of Engineering and Applied Science emphasizes a hands-on approach to education and after a semester of online labs and lectures, students are concerned by the possibility of more virtual classes.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Penn outlines four possible scenarios for fall 2020, will finalize plan by end of June

From the studio to a virtual exhibition: Fine Arts majors adjust to online education

dominantMedia.title: Penn Engineering Quad.jpg
dominantMedia.content: In the switch to virtual instruction, critical hands-on instruction was lost for engineering students.

filteredArticles.headline: From the studio to a virtual exhibition: Fine Arts majors adjust to online education
filteredArticles.abstract: Fine Arts students and professors were forced to create work and instruct classes without access to the University's high quality multi-media equipment.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

New School of Design degree program focuses on using robotics in architecture

dominantMedia.title: Error 404 Fine Arts Senior Thesis Exhibition.png
dominantMedia.content: Although Fine Arts seniors had to clear their physical studio spaces, their theses have been rendered in a 3D modeled space. (Photo from www.error404exhibition.com)

filteredArticles.headline: Penn ranked eighth best U.S. university by Quacquarelli Symonds
filteredArticles.abstract: The University ranked fourth in the Ivy League, behind Harvard University, Columbia University, and Yale University.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

dominantMedia.title: College Hall Penn Flag.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Quacquarelli Symonds ranked Penn eighth overall in the United States and fourth in the Ivy League.

filteredArticles.headline: In new summer video series, SAS professors lecture on music, philosophy, and physics
filteredArticles.abstract: The Big Ideas for Strange Times series launched on May 15, and includes five-minute lectures on "ideas that transcend the immediate crisis of the pandemic." One video lecture will be broadcasted each week throughout the summer.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

dominantMedia.title: Big Ideas for Strange Times.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Big Ideas for Strange Times lectures are short enough to be accessible to students, yet still pique interest in the various topics.

filteredArticles.headline: In a new course this fall, students will create and study the history of digital fakes
filteredArticles.abstract: The English and Cinema Studies departments are offering a new course this fall, titled "Fakes, Forgeries, and Forensics in Digital Media."

filteredArticles.headline: LPS launches free online course to teach resilience and increase optimism during pandemic
filteredArticles.abstract: The course, titled “Resilience Skills in a Time of Uncertainty,” launched on the online learning platform Coursera in April.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

dominantMedia.title: Flower Resilience Course.jpg
dominantMedia.content: “Resilience Skills in a Time of Uncertainty” has been released for free so more people can have access to it during the coronavirus pandemic.

filteredArticles.headline: Students and professors grapple with unprecedented remote finals season
filteredArticles.abstract: Many professors had to change the format of their final exams to accommodate for students’ varying time zones, lack of proctoring methods, and other at-home difficulties.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Disillusioned students consider gap semesters if fall courses are held online

Penn offers limited summer work-study program amid coronavirus pandemic

dominantMedia.title: Silfen Study Center Williams Hall
dominantMedia.content: The Silfen Study Center in Williams Hall, a popular place to study for finals, now sits empty.

filteredArticles.headline: Penn Global Seminars plan to operate as normal despite uncertainty of fall semester
filteredArticles.abstract: Penn Abroad will monitor the pandemic and international travel policies in the coming months, but is optimistic students will be able to travel safely by winter break.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Study abroad students didn't have the semester they imagined. Now, they're happy to be home.

Penn Abroad will decide fate of fall study abroad programs by May 15

dominantMedia.title: Penn Global Seminars Globe Travel.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Penn Global Seminars are still expected to operate as normal in the fall semester.

filteredArticles.headline: Here’s how the Ivy League is planning for the fall semester
filteredArticles.abstract: All schools in the Ivy League have not yet announced decisions, leaving many options on the table, but most have ruled out the possibility of postponing the fall semester.
filteredArticles.infobox:

filteredArticles.headline: Disillusioned students consider gap semesters if fall courses are held online
filteredArticles.abstract: University administration said they have no plans to amend the current leave of absence policy for the fall semester.

dominantMedia.title: Leave of Absence Suitcase Move Out Travel Locust Walk 001.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Some students considering a leave of absence cite not wanting to pay full tuition for online classes.

filteredArticles.headline: Two Penn juniors win Truman Scholarship to fund grad studies for public service careers
filteredArticles.abstract: College juniors Annah Chollet and Camilo Duran are among 62 winners selected from a pool of 773 candidates nationwide.

dominantMedia.title: Truman Scholars Collage.jpg

filteredArticles.headline: Wharton will offer quantitative finance major for MBA students starting this fall
filteredArticles.abstract: Although Wharton currently offers a finance major to MBA students, new courses have been created specifically for the quantitative finance major, including classes in data science, asset pricing, and financial engineering.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

dominantMedia.title: Huntsman Hall Wharton.jpg
dominantMedia.content: The new quantitative finance major will be housed under Wharton’s Finance Department.

filteredArticles.headline: Gutmann criticizes U.S. for ‘striking lack’ of global leadership during coronavirus course
filteredArticles.abstract: Gutmann also discussed the process of making major decisions such as asking undergraduates to move off campus and shifting to remote learning. She said that the University has not yet decided when students will be allowed back at Penn.

dominantMedia.content: The hour-long question and answer session with President Amy Gutmann was moderated by Wharton School Dean Geoffrey Garrett.

filteredArticles.headline: Penn students launch website with resources for new FGLI students at 15 peer universities
filteredArticles.abstract: The website, called The Virtual Vine, will feature weekly videos created by ambassadors from 15 universities for incoming students to learn about resources for academics, research, financial aid, and student life.

dominantMedia.title: Virtual Vine Collage Final.jpg
dominantMedia.content: College first-years Ryan Afreen (left) and Collin Marlin (right) started the Virtual Vine to provide a platform for incoming FGLI students to learn about resources and the college experience from current students. (Photos from Ryan Afreen and Collin Marlin)
